page.title: 05WILLIAM TYNDALE(c.1492-1536)
page.content: William Tyndale, translator of the Bible was born in Slimbridge in 1492. He thought that the Bible should be translated into English. Tyndale was a Latin and Greek tutor to a bishop's children, the bishop disagreed with Tyndale about his ideas but Tyndale swore he would translate the Bible. Tyndale went to Germany to escape the clergy who did not wish him to translate it. He persuaded German government officials to transport the translated Bibles into England, and they were sold privately to those who could afford it. Bishops in England were angry - as expected. Tyndale was caught in 1535 and then strangled and burnt in 1536. His last words were "Lord open the King of England's eyes." Three years later his prayer was answered.
